title: George Russell: Mercedes 2026 car isn't a "turd", but too early for F1 title talk
description: Russell is currently favourite for the 2026 Formula 1 title with Mercedes coming out of last week's Barcelona shakedown looking the strongest
fullText:
Formula 1 2026 world championship favourite George Russell is confident Mercedes has produced a strong car for the upcoming season - but refused to declare it a potential title contender.

This year, F1 will introduce a whole new set of regulations with changes to both the chassis and power unit and as everything is new, the pecking order is currently a guessing game.

But expectations are high at Mercedes, considering the Silver Arrows dominated the last engine switch in 2014 by winning the next eight championships, while it also enjoyed a strong Barcelona shakedown last week.

It completed the most mileage of any team and Russell‚Äôs team-mate Andrea Kimi Antonelli even conducted a full race simulation, causing engineering director Andrew Shovlin to claim ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we could have hoped for a better three days of testing‚Äù.

This has led to Russell topping the odds for this year‚Äôs title, especially after his strongest season yet in 2025 with fourth in the standings and to many, being the best driver behind Max Verstappen.

But he is still wary of his rivals with two official Bahrain tests to come before the season-opening Australian Grand Prix on 6-8 March.

‚ÄúObviously we've only driven the car for three days and it's still very early days, but it doesn't look like it's a turd, which is a bonus,‚Äù said the five-time grand prix winner at the Mercedes 2026 launch on Monday.

‚ÄúTo be honest, in the early days like this, you know when it could be a really bad car and you can highlight those negatives early on, we don't believe it is. But is it a car that can produce a world championship? It's still way too early to see.

‚ÄúWe've been quite surprised by what we've seen from some of our rivals, especially on the Red Bull power unit side, that looks very impressive considering they're a completely new outfit and reliable as well.

‚ÄúSo kudos to them. We've had a very reliable test, but we'll have to wait and see if the car lives up to the expectation.‚Äù

The situation marks a far cry from 2022 when ground-effect cars were introduced for Russell‚Äôs debut season at Mercedes, whose dominance was ended with the last rule switch.

Four years ago, the German marque produced a very unpredictable car that endured vast porpoising and this made it hard for Mercedes to recover, as the subsequent titles went to Red Bull or McLaren.

But now, Russell believes Mercedes has built a nice, drivable car as he said: ‚ÄúNobody expected porpoising in ‚Äò22. So you can‚Äôt discount everything right now. But that's why I think we left Barcelona with a positive feeling because the car reacted as we anticipated.

‚ÄúThe numbers we're seeing from the aero on the car match what we see back on the simulator, how the car is handling is matching how it feels on the simulator. So this is something we've not really experienced since 2021 as a team.

‚ÄúSo we're sort of ticking the boxes of everything that we want to tick. But we can't discount our rivals because, as I said, there was a lot of talk around the Red Bull power unit not being up to standard year one - from what we've seen so far, they've definitely delivered.

‚ÄúFerrari power unit looks reliable. They did lots of laps not far behind us over the course of a test and from a power unit side, Haas did loads of laps as well with the Ferrari engine. So the truth is that there could be a good fight on our hands, but we're satisfied with what we've experienced.‚Äù

Although the 27-year-old is still somewhat playing down expectations ahead of the campaign, Russell does have the confidence of a driver who can finally take his maiden F1 crown.

When the title favourite tag was put to the Briton, he said: ‚ÄúI didn't really feel anything from hearing that, to be honest.

‚ÄúAs I've said for a long time, I feel ready to fight for a world championship and whether we have that comment above us or not, that does not change my approach one single bit.

‚ÄúI'm working so hard with the team. Everybody here has been working flat out to really maximise this new set of regulations and I'm honestly just so excited by the challenge because it is a huge challenge adapting to these new cars, how the energy management works, the re-harvesting of the batteries, getting your head around the boost system, the overtake modes, the active aero.

‚ÄúThere's a lot of things we need to learn very quickly, but I feel I can take advantage from that and I feel confident with myself and my team.‚Äù

The challenges facing Mercedes ahead of F1 2026

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: ‚ÄòHe Was A Steal For Us‚Äô: Maple Leafs Trading Of Prospect Fraser Minten To Boston Not Aging Well
description: As the Maple Leafs risk missing the postseason for the first time in a decade, the immediate success of Fraser Minten in Boston is turning the Brandon Carlo trade into the latest chapter in a long history of lopsided deals between the two rivals.
fullText:
It‚Äôs been less than a year since the Toronto Maple Leafs shipped Fraser Minten, along with a top-five protected first-round pick in the 2026 NHL Draft, to Boston for veteran defenseman Brandon Carlo. While the Leafs certainly needed a player like Carlo, a right-handed shutdown defenseman who could play alongside Morgan Rielly, few would have predicted that Toronto would find themselves on the short end of the deal so quickly.

With the Leafs appearing bound to miss the playoffs for the first time in ten years, Minten has excelled with his new team. He was named the NHL‚Äôs Rookie of the Month for January after scoring eight goals and adding six assists in 14 games. Recently, he was promoted to the club‚Äôs first line to play alongside Morgan Geekie and David Pastrnak before moving back to the second-line center position.

‚ÄúHe was a steal for us,‚Äù Bruins head coach Marco Sturm said regarding the acquisition. Perhaps more impressive is that all eight of Minten‚Äôs goals came at even strength, as he was not slated to receive significant power-play time.

Fraser Minten of the @NHLBruins, who topped all rookies with 8-6‚Äî14 and a +12 rating in 14 games, has been named the NHL‚Äôs ‚ÄúRookie of the Month‚Äù for January.#NHLStats: https://t.co/idkVX4OOtV pic.twitter.com/HbZNsruplR

‚Äî NHL Public Relations (@NHLPR) February 1, 2026

‚ÄúI‚Äôm very, very happy with the way he‚Äôs been playing all year long,‚Äù Sturm added. ‚ÄúI put him in different situations from the fourth line to pretty much the first line, and you could see he can do it all. He definitely has something a lot of players don‚Äôt have‚Äù.

Meanwhile, Carlo has missed 23 games this season due to an ankle injury that required a corrective procedure. While injuries have contributed to Toronto‚Äôs struggles, handing Boston a high first-round pick is a tough pill to swallow‚Äîunless, of course, that pick remains in the top five.

Marco Sturm on Fraser Minten: "[He] was a steal for us."

Everyone say #ThankYouToronto ü§≠ pic.twitter.com/VlnzsxRTsk

‚Äî NESN (@NESN) January 30, 2026

As Minten thrives, the trade is shaping up to be another lopsided Toronto-Boston transaction. History offers a grim reminder: in 2006, the Leafs traded goaltending prospect Tuukka Rask for Andrew Raycroft. Rask became a franchise icon, winning a Vezina Trophy and serving as a backup for the 2011 Stanley Cup-winning team before making two more Final appearances as a starter. He retired as the winningest netminder in Bruins history. Raycroft, by contrast, spent only two seasons in Toronto with mediocre results, despite a 37-win debut season.

The #OverDrive crew look back on the Brandon Carlo/Fraser Minten trade.

Do you think the Leafs lost that trade, in hindsight? üëÄ@OverDrive1050 pic.twitter.com/2PnkR7DNgn

‚Äî TSN (@TSN_Sports) January 30, 2026

Similarly, in 2009, the Leafs acquired Phil Kessel from the Bruins. While Kessel led the Leafs in scoring for six seasons, the acquisition cost Toronto two first-round picks and a second-round pick. Those first-rounders became Tyler Seguin (2nd overall) and Dougie Hamilton (9th overall)‚Äîboth high-end talents who have enjoyed long, successful careers.

title: When does the January transfer window close? Key dates for Premier League, European big five in 2026
description: The January transfer window is a key time for clubs, and an exciting one for fans.
fullText:
When does the January transfer window close? Key dates for Premier League, European big five in 2026 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The January transfer window allows clubs across Europe to add mid-season reinforcements and make alterations as a reaction to their current positioning and squad health.

Some clubs may wish to add players due to injuries, poor performance, or a strong first half of the campaign, which has positioned them to achieve more than they expected.

Others, meanwhile, may wish to move on from disgruntled players or get some cash for those who are slated to leave in the summer for free.

The Sporting News brings you a roundup of when the transfer window opens and closes across the major European leagues, who have come together in recent years to align their calendars with one another for a more streamlined process.

MORE:Updated list of Premier League top goal scorers for 2025/26 season

The 2026 January transfer window closes for Premier League clubs onp.m. GMT¬†(2 p.m. ET).

This is because the traditional closing date, January 31, falls on a Saturday, and as such it will close on the following Monday.

Like the open date, the closing date is also matched for all of the major European leagues, meaning England, Spain, Germany, Italy, and France's top flights all have the same closing date.

The only slight quirk is the time of day the window closes on. Serie A, Ligue 1, and the Bundesliga have synced with the Premier League perfectly, also closing at 7 p.m. GMT / 8 p.m. CET. However, the transfer window in Spain closes at 11:59 p.m. CET.

The January transfer window is a month-long period during which clubs can make changes to their roster.

Technically, a "transfer window" is actually a registration period, during which teams can register new players and make general changes to their league-official squad.

Players acquired outside a transfer window cannot be registered until the new window opens.

Additionally, starting January 1, players who are out of contract in the summer are allowed to sign a pre-contract agreement with a new club, under certain circumstances (e.g. Premier League players can sign for a foreign team). They are still contracted to their current club through the end of the season, but they are able to sign agreements with a new team to take effect at the expiration of their current deal.

title: Toto Wolff slams F1 rivals amid 2026 engine row: ‚ÄòThey want to find excuses‚Äô
description: An engine controversy, with Ferrari, Audi and Honda complaining to the FIA over a ‚Äòloophole‚Äô Mercedes and Red Bull have found, was sharply dismissed by the Mercedes F1 CEO on Monday
fullText:
Toto Wolff has slammed Mercedes‚Äô F1 rivals over the sport‚Äôs engine controversy ahead of the 2026 season, sharply telling them to ‚Äúget their s*** together.‚Äù

In one of the sport‚Äôs biggest-ever rule changes, new engine and chassis regulations are being introduced this year, with Mercedes the frontrunners after last week‚Äôs first pre-season test in Barcelona. However, a divide between the five engine manufacturers has already emerged over the off-season.

Ferrari, Audi and Honda have complained to the FIA (F1‚Äôs governing body) about Mercedes and Red Bull finding an engine ‚Äúloophole‚Äù. The matter in question concerns the compression ratio of the internal combustion engine, specifically the ratio between the cylinder‚Äôs maximum and minimum volume. The rules mandate a 16:1 ratio, measured at an ‚Äúambient temperature‚Äù while the car is stationary, but Mercedes and Red Bull are believed to be exploiting thermal expansion, which would lead the compression ratio to be closer to the old 18:1 regulation while running on track.

Such an advantage could help teams by up to 0.3 seconds per lap and, as such, the other three engine manufacturers have written to the FIA insisting a ratio higher than the 16:1 figure mandated would be against the rules. Further meetings with the FIA on the matter are expected in the coming weeks.

Yet Mercedes team principal Wolff, speaking after the team‚Äôs 2026 car launch on Monday, criticised the outrage amongst other teams: ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt understand that some teams concentrate more on others and keep arguing a case that is very clear and transparent.

‚ÄúCommunication with the FIA was very positive all along, not only on compression ratio but other things too. Specifically in that area, it‚Äôs very clear what the regulations say, what the standard procedures are.

‚ÄúSo just get your s*** together. Doing secret meetings and letters, and inventing ways of testing which don‚Äôt exist‚Ä¶ I can just say at least from us, we‚Äôre trying to minimise distractions and that‚Äôs looking more at us, not everybody else.‚Äù

Red Bull engine boss Ben Hodgkinson, formerly of Mercedes, also insisted he could not comprehend why a row has broken out ‚Äì a viewpoint Wolff also threw his weight behind, with just five weeks until the season-opening race in Australia on 8 March.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty clear what the regulations say,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúMaybe we‚Äôre all different, maybe you want to find excuses before you‚Äôve even started.

‚ÄúEverybody needs to do it to the best of their ability, but that‚Äôs not how we do things, especially if you‚Äôve been told a few times it‚Äôs fine. It‚Äôs legal and what the regulations say. If someone wants to entertain themselves by distraction, they‚Äôre free to do that.‚Äù

Given Mercedes‚Äôs impressive execution in the last engine regulation change in 2014, leading to eight consecutive constructors‚Äô titles, the Silver Arrows are thought to be at the front of the pecking order ahead of two more pre-season tests in Bahrain later this month.

George Russell is the early title favourite for the drivers‚Äô championship, ahead of Red Bull‚Äôs Max Verstappen.c‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always nice if your driver is the favourite,‚Äù Wolff added.

‚ÄúHe [George] deserves it because he‚Äôs one of the best. He‚Äôs been overall more than great for us, but it‚Äôs the best driver and best car that wins.

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt yet proven that there is a package which is good enough. I‚Äôd hope the bookmakers are right, but I‚Äôll believe it when we have seen performances that have confirmed that.‚Äù

The next pre-season test is in Bahrain on 11-13 February.

title: Pick of the stats: Sheffield United v Oxford United
description: Here are the key stats for Sheffield United v Oxford United.
fullText:
Oxford United will try to get back to earning points when they visit Sheffield United on Tuesday (19:45 GMT) as they fight against relegation.

The U's three league match undefeated streak came to an end on the weekend after being bested by Birmingham City.

It keeps them five points away from safety, nine below their hosts.

Sheffield United have won nine of their last 12 league meetings with Oxford United (L3), after winning six of their first 17 matches against the U's in the Football League between 1968 and 1990 (D5 L6).

Oxford United have lost five of their last six away league games against Sheffield United, with the exception a 2-1 win at Bramall Lane in March 1999 under Malcolm Shotton.

Sheffield United are unbeaten in each of their last seven home league games (W5 D2), winning their last three while also scoring exactly three goals. The Blades last won more consecutively at Bramall Lane, while scoring more than twice in each victory, back in August 1971 (5).

Oxford United beat Leicester City 2-1 in their most recent Championship away game, and the U's could now win back-to-back league matches on the road for the first time since April 2024 in League One.

Sheffield United's Chris Wilder has won seven of his 10 league games as a manager against former club Oxford United (D1 L2), only boasting a better win rate in the Football League against Dagenham and Redbridge (80% - 8/10) than the U's (70%), among those he has faced 10+ times.

title: Liverpool to be beaten to centre-back by MONSTROUS deadline-day bid
description: Premier League rivals submit ‚Äòmonster‚Äô bid for OrdonezAccording to a report from Belgium outlet Het Laatste Nieuws, Crystal Palace have entered the race for Ordonez, seeing a ‚Äòmonstrous‚Äô ‚Ç¨40...
fullText:
According to a report from Belgium outlet Het Laatste Nieuws, Crystal Palace have entered the race for Ordonez, seeing a ‚Äòmonstrous‚Äô ‚Ç¨40 million bid rejected on Sunday night.

That fee would represent a club record departure for Brugge, and Palace seem likely to return with an improved offer to try and bolster their defence before the deadline.

The report claims Liverpool are still interested in Ordonez, as did reports in England on Sunday, but with a ~¬£60 million deal for Jacquet in the works it feels unlikely that the Reds will match Palace‚Äôs offer this late in the window.

Ordonez could make an instant impact at Liverpool, who currently only have two senior central defenders available, but ensuring the deal for Jacquet gets over the line will be Richard Hughes‚Äô priority on deadline day.

If Palace do fail to get their man, a summer move for Ordonez cannot be ruled out at Anfield, but if the Eagles are willing to improve their bid, then the Reds will probably miss out on another target.

A late swoop from Liverpool on deadline seems unlikely but isn‚Äôt impossible, but the club would be leaving it very late, and Club Brugge are not desperate to sell so an agreement would be hard to reach.

title: 16 NFL teams (including the Broncos) eligible for 'Hard Knocks' this summer
description: Half the league (including the Broncos) are eligible for 'Hard Knocks' this summer.
fullText:
Half of the NFL's 32 teams are eligible to be forced into "Hard Knocks" this summer, including the Denver Broncos.

Last year, the league changed its criteria for teams that can't turn down an appearance on the popular HBO and NFL Films show that follows a club through training camp. Now, teams can decline if they have a first-year head coach, are part of the division featured on the in-season version of "Hard Knocks," or have been featured on the training camp version within the last eight seasons.

It's still possible that the AFC West could be chosen as the division for the in-season version of "Hard Knocks" in 2026. If that happens, Denver would not be selected for the summer show. If the AFC West is not selected, the Broncos will be eligible to be featured during training camp.

With a hat tip to @NerdingonNFL, here's a look at the 16 teams that could be featured on "Hard Knocks" this summer.

Last year, the NFL announced the in-season division (the NFC East) and the training camp team (the Buffalo Bills) in May. The league will likely follow a similar timeline in 2026.

Social: Follow¬†Broncos Wire¬†on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†Twitter/X!¬†Did you know:¬†These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL news: Broncos among 16 teams eligible for Hard Knocks this summer

title: Texas A&M tied for most Quad 1A wins in the SEC before facing Alabama
description: Texas A&M enters the new week with three all-important Quad 1A wins, tied with Tennessee and Kentucky for the most in the SEC.
fullText:
Texas A&M's (17-4, 7-1 SEC) NCAA Tournament resume is looking better every week, as the Aggies are riding a four-game winning streak in SEC play after defeating Georgia on the road 92-77 behind another balanced scoring effort resulting in five players scoring in double figures, led by senior forward Rashaun Agee's 18 points, 15 rebounds and seven assists, recorded his tenth double-double of the season.

Under first-year head coach Bucky McMillan, the Aggies aren't lacking confidence, and after losing a close game to SMU on the road during the latter half of non-conference play, Texas A&M has lost just one game since, dropping a double-overtime road matchup vs. Tennessee, which should have gone the other way if free throws and questionable officiating weren't an issue.

Leading the SEC at 7-1, three of Texas A&M's conference wins are Quad 1A victories, which, according to the NCAA NET rankings, are wins against teams ranked in the top 15 ranked teams at home, top 25 on a neutral court, and top 40 on the road in the NET standings. Tied with Tennessee and Kentucky, here are the SEC teams with more than one Quad 1A win.

Over the next four games against Alabama (road), Florida (home), Missouri (road), and Vanderbilt (road), Texas A&M will have three Quad 1A opportunities, and winning one, or two of these tough matchups would likely guarentee the Aggies an at-large bid in the NCAA Tournament, especially given the fact that McMillan's squad is a perfect 12-0 in Quad 3 and Quad 3 games.

After Florida blew out Alabama 100-77 on Sunday night, Texas A&M has a chance to take advantage of the Crimson Tide's short turnaround before playing on Wednesday, but needs to play with the same mentality, and shoot at least 45% from the field, and hit free throws to have a chance at pulling off the upset.

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X¬†(formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.¬†Follow Cameron on X:¬†@CameronOhnysty.

This article originally appeared on Aggies Wire: Texas A&M basketball's three Quad 1A wins tied for most in the SEC

fullText:
PIF-funded Saudi Pro League side Al-Ittihhad has reached a ‚Ç¨33m agreement with AS Monaco to sign striker George Ilenikhena (19), according to RMC Sport‚Äôs Fabrice Hawkins.¬†Talks are reportedly underway between Ilenikhena and the Saudi outfit over finding an agreement on personal terms.

Al-Ittihad are in the market for a centre-forward due to the uncertainty surrounding 2022 Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner Karim Benzema. The former Real Madrid striker is expected to leave the Jeddah-based SPL club over a disagreement regarding Al-Ittihad‚Äôs contractual renewal offer.

Ilenikhena joined AS Monaco 18 months ago from Royal Antwerp in a reported ‚Ç¨17m transfer fee, which is nearly half of Al-Ittihad‚Äôs proposal despite Ilenikhena scoring only ten goals in 51 games with the Principality club.

title: Former Inter target Branimir Mlacic in Rome for Udinese medical
description: Branimir Mlacic has arrived in Italy to undertake his Udinese medical in Rome. After being linked with Inter for a long time, that deal fell through following a change of agent.Working with his new ag...
fullText:
Branimir Mlacic has arrived in Italy to undertake his Udinese medical in Rome. After being linked with Inter for a long time, that deal fell through following a change of agent.

Working with his new agent Fali Ramadani, the 18-year-old is now nearing the end of this ‚Ç¨5.5 million switch from hometown club Hajduk Split.

This season, the 6 ft 4 central defender has really impressed, making 19 appearances and providing two assists in all competitions.

Since 2024, Mlacic has also undergone some dramatic international development, moving quickly from Croatia‚Äôs U18 to U21 setup.

Today, he‚Äôs at the Villa Stuart clinic to complete his medical. He‚Äôll then sign a five-year contract with Udinese.

title: Titans improbable victory over Cardinals one of the top stories in 2025
description: The Tennessee Titans improbable 2025 victory over the Arizona Cardinals made it's way into the CBS Sports countdown of the top 25 stories of 2025.
fullText:
The Tennessee Titans are coming off a dismal season that led to a massive overhaul of the organization. Gone is Brian Callahan, and most of his staff, and the Titans have a new head coach in Robert Saleh. But that doesn‚Äôt mean that Tennessee didn't have some highlights.

One of those that marked Callahan‚Äôs last victory as Titans‚Äô head coach, and much like the majority of his tenure, it was a fluke. Incredibly, this victory over the Arizona Cardinals was so improbable that it landed on CBS Sports' top 25 stories of the 2025 season.

22. Tennessee Titans at Arizona Cardinals, Week 5: Cardinals, Jonathan Gannon, Kyler Murray, Emari Demercado collapse

This one requires us to go back quite a bit, but the butterfly effect is startling. The Cardinals, up 21-3 at home against the then-winless Tennessee Titans, suffered one of the wildest and most inexcusable collapses in recent memory en route to a 22-21 defeat.

Although the Cardinals basically handed the Titans the victory, Tennessee looked competitive in the fourth quarter and made the plays necessary for the win, with Cam Ward making some big-time throws to give them a chance.

The Titans would go on to fire Callahan a couple of weeks later, with the win being the highlight of his final weeks in Nashville. But for that week, the football gods looked down on the Titans and gave them a memorable moment in the 2025 season.

This article originally appeared on Titans Wire: Titans improbable victory over Cardinals one of the top stories in 2025

title: Social media reacts to Notre Dame to hire Aaron Henry as co-DC
description: Notre Dame football is expect to hire Illinois DC Aaron Henry as its next defensive backs coach and co-DC, and here are the top social media reactions.
fullText:
Notre Dame football had a big hole to fill when defensive backs coach Mike Mickens decided to leave for the NFL, but head coach Marcus Freeman filled the role on Sunday afternoon.

Aaron Henry, the now former defensive coordinator for Illinois will join the Irish according Matt Zenitz of CBS Sports. Like he has done in the past, Freeman made a fantastic hire, one where Henry will coach defensive backs along with being the co-defensive coordinator with Chris Ash.

Like social media always does, there were plenty of positive Notre Dame reactions to this hire. Find out below some of the best social media post about the news of the Irish hiring Henry.

Man that is an enormous move from Notre Dame. Henry is a rising star and getting him to take a functional demotion is a sign of how much cache the Irish have right now. https://t.co/hDoDq5cAoS

‚Äî Dylan Sinn (@DylanSinn) February 1, 2026

There aren‚Äôt many programs around the country where a defensive coordinator would take a ‚Äúdemotion‚Äù to join a team, but that‚Äôs what happened here. Notre Dame has plenty of clout in the coaching world right now.

According to a source, Notre Dame is expected to Aaron Henry as its new defensive backs coach, replacing Mike Mickens. Henry was defensive coordinator at Illinois the past three seasons.

Henry coached defensive backs for Chris Ash at Rutgers in 2016.

‚Äî Pete Sampson (@PeteSampson_) February 1, 2026

Relationships matter, and with the hiring of Henry, he‚Äôs be reunited with his former boss, Ash. The familiarity between the two will go a long way towards the transition of the defensive side of the ball.

Missed this a bit earlier. Marcus Freeman with a statement hire. https://t.co/zwyBwxDGje

‚Äî Greg Smith (@GregSmithRivals) February 1, 2026

While the multiple defensive coaching changes could have doomed the Irish, it doesn‚Äôt look like that will be the case. Freeman has done it again, as Notre Dame shouldn‚Äôt miss a beat with Henry coaching the secondary.

A big hire for Notre Dame.

There were multiple NFL teams that had interest in Henry this cycle, including the Jacksonville Jaguars (whom he interviewed with), before he ultimately decided to accept this job with the Fighting Irish.https://t.co/4GOwOvHqCZ https://t.co/ZoeA3WQ8JJ

‚Äî Matt Zenitz (@mzenitz) February 1, 2026

It‚Äôs hard to turn down the NFL, but that‚Äôs exactly what Henry did with this move. He‚Äôll still be a wanted man in the coming seasons, but for right now, he‚Äôs with Notre Dame.

Marcus Freeman is just flat out one of the best in college football at surrounding himself with an elite staff 

Every time Notre Dame loses a stud coach from their staff, Freeman makes an A+ hire to replace them https://t.co/PPp2bLe7JZ

‚Äî Always Talkin‚Äô Ball Podcast (@AlwaysTalkBall) February 1, 2026

It‚Äôs pretty clear how you win at the college level now, having an older roster and an elite coaching staff, which it very much looks like Notre Dame will have this coming season. The expectations won‚Äôt be changed with Henry‚Äôs impending hire, win the College Football Playoff.

Oh and Aaron Henry coached Kerby Joseph into an All-Big Ten player Illinois after one season as a full time safety.

Joseph was All-Pro for the Detroit Lions after leading the league in INTs (9) in 2024.

It‚Äôs one thing to send a 5-star or high 4-stars to the NFL, its entirely another to take lower ranked recruits and turn them into NFL draft picks, which is exactly what Henry has done. Imagine what he‚Äôs going to do with top-level players, it‚Äôs‚Äô going to be impressive.

FIU, Arkansas, Rutgers, NC State, Vanderbilt, Baylor, Illinois.

‚Äî CathVSConf‚òòÔ∏è (@CathVSConf) February 1, 2026

Just a few years ago, Henry coached the top scoring defense in the country. There is no doubt in my mind that he can get Notre Dame close to that level too.

This is a chess move. Ash is probably gone after next year and Marcus can just remove the co- tag https://t.co/ljViGNwhBQ

‚Äî Brendan (@verypiratey) February 1, 2026

With what Ash did last fall, and what he‚Äôs expected to do this season, there could be multiple teams looking to poach him from South Bend after the year ends. It would be a smooth transition to make Henry the full-time defensive coordinator if Ash does move on.

I‚Äôm sorry, did we just pull a Defensive Coordinator from the B1G to be our DBs coach? üëÄ https://t.co/Pgp55I7l2r

‚Äî The 4 Horsemen Podcast (@HorsemenPod) February 1, 2026

Henry will be more than just a defensive backs coach, but it‚Äôs still very impressive that Notre Dame pulled off this feat. Call it the Freeman-effect, as coaches see that he‚Äôs a superstar in the making.

title: Who gets the start at inside linebacker for Commanders in 2026?
description: Can this young Commanders' linebacker be a permanent starter in 2026?
fullText:
Who is going to be the Washington Commanders' starting middle linebacker in 2026?

Rising third-year linebacker Jordan Magee, from Temple University, was interviewed very briefly recently by Ben Standig, and Standig played the interview this past week on his podcast.

WSH LB Jordan Magee in space vs. Achane#RaiseHail pic.twitter.com/HD3cmf6Itw

‚Äî Last of the Fullbacks (@TheLastFullback) November 19, 2025

Where Jordan Magee started only one game in 2024, he showed improvement and was more healthy, starting eight games in 2025. Where in 2024 Magee was in on nine tackles, this past season, he was in on 54 tackles, three of which were for a loss. "I thought there was a lot of growth for me as a player," expressed Magee. "As I got out on the field more, I got more comfortable."

Going from his first year to his second, can be a time where your knowledge has increased, one can be much more relaxed, not tight mentally in games. Consequently, not pressing to think, one finds they can react much more freely and quickly. "I wanted to work on getting off of blocks better. Working on my tackling, my tracking ability. For me, I want to play lower, for better leverage. So I work on my knee bend, trying to stay low while moving."

Bobby Wagner has been a great teacher and teammate. Wagner is known to be quite the leader in the classroom, in the film room, and on the field. Wagner reached a milestone the final game of the 2025 season when he recorded his career tackle No. 2000. The Commanders have a major decision to make regarding Wagner. He was clearly still a great run defender in between the tackles, but has lost a step or two in going sideline to sideline and in pass coverage.

But for Magee, it is still all about respect for Wagner on and off the football field. "I appreciate him for everything that he has helped me with. I will probably go to his graduation in May (MBA from Howard U). You always got to show love and gratitude to somebody who accomplished that type of thing."

As for this 2026 offseason, what are the plans for Magee? Well, he will certainly be lifting and working out. He wants to keep his job in the NFL, entering his third season with the Commanders. But he also has a special trip that he wants to make this offseason.

Magee said he wanted to go to Tokyo last year, but an injury needed rehab, so he did the work instead. He said he and his girlfriend plan to go this offseason to see what life and the culture are like in a major city in Japan.

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Can Jordan Magee replace Bobby Wagner?

title: How Premier League sides can still register players after deadline
description: The transfer window closes tonight at 7pm after over a month of business across the Premier League. However, fans hoping to see late activity in the market at their clubs can keep the faith beyond 7pm.
fullText:
The transfer window closes tonight at 7pm after over a month of business across the Premier League.

However, fans hoping to see late activity in the market at their clubs can keep the faith beyond 7pm.

Clubs are still allowed to strike deals after that time, provided they meet a specific rule that grants them a two-hour extension to finalise signings.

A deal sheet is effectively a way for clubs to tell the Premier League that a transfer has been agreed ‚Äì but they just need a bit more time to finalise the official documents.

Premier League clubs can only use a deal sheet after 5pm, and it must be submitted before 7pm.

If all the relevant details are filled in, the Premier League grant an extra two hours for the deal to be completed.

You can see an example of a deal sheet below.

Arsenal signed Raheem Sterling using a deal sheet in summer 2024 ‚Äì and once all media duties had been carried out, the Gunners ended up announcing the signing around 2am.

However, this is only applicable to domestic transfers, and clubs must comply with the FIFA Transfer Matching System (TMS) deadline of midnight if they want to complete an international signing from abroad.

The Premier League describe the FIFA Transfer Matching System as follows.

‚ÄúWhen there is an international transfer, the buying and selling clubs have to register it on FIFA‚Äôs Transfer Matching System (TMS) in order for international clearance to be generated.

‚ÄúThe buying club have to upload all the information to the system and the foreign club have to match all the details.

‚ÄúOur FA will request clearance and, as long as everything matches, the foreign association will issue clearance to the FA, who then informs the club and League.‚Äù

In years gone by, those in the English Football League (EFL) ‚Äì meaning Championship, League One and League Two clubs ‚Äì have also been allowed to submit a deal sheet for late transfers.

However, the EFL have now put a stop to it.

An official statement reads: ‚ÄúIn the EFL, all documentation must be provided prior to the deadline closing for the registration of a player to go through.‚Äù

There is ‚Äì however ‚Äì the presence of a ‚Äòquick application‚Äô which gives EFL clubs an extra 15 minutes to finalise transfers.

It is said: ‚ÄúIf a club is in a Full Application at 10:30pm, they will receive a warning that states the system will open a Quick Application at 10:45pm, where only certain fields need to be completed.

‚ÄúIn those last 15 minutes of the Transfer Window, EFL systems allow clubs to submit the necessary registration form without completing the full application process. Where they do this, the clubs then have a further 15 minutes to complete the full application process. This avoids clubs missing the deadline in circumstances where they have agreed and signed all necessary documents with another club and the player before 11pm, but still need time to complete the full application.‚Äù

title: Colorado football targeting a 2028 quarterback from Valor Christian
description: Colorado is monitoring 2028 in-state QB Titus Huard, son of Brock Huard, as the Valor Christian standout gains national recruiting attention.
fullText:
Under head coach Deion Sanders, Colorado football has largely neglected the state in high school recruiting. While the Centennial State is not known for being a football powerhouse, there are diamonds in the rough each year.

One of those diamonds is class of 2028 quarterback Titus Huard, son of former University of Washington and Seattle Seahawks quarterback Brock Huard. The Buffs made an offer to Huard on Sunday, joining several schools that had recently offered the quarterback.

The younger Huard plays for former Colorado interim head coach Mike Sanford at Valor Christian High School in Littleton, Colorado, where his father is also the tight ends coach.

Huard has yet to be ranked by any recruiting outlet, but his 14 offers as a sophomore make him an already hot commodity on the recruiting trail. He holds offers from Washington, Texas Tech, Oregon, Colorado State, Kansas State, Arkansas and others.

After a great talk with @CoachHouli I‚Äôm extremely honored to recieve an offer from @CUBuffsFootball!! #skobuffs @Coach_Sanford2 @GoValorFootball @kngdmsp @BrandonHuffman @adamgorney @TommyVento16 @DeionSanders pic.twitter.com/Vn7mc7kiUu

‚Äî Titus Huard (@Titushuard7) February 1, 2026

At 6-foot-5, 205 pounds, Huard is a prototypical size for a quarterback, but also a starting pitcher. Huard advertises himself on social media as a quarterback, pitcher and power forward. He clearly has the quarterback position down, but it will be interesting to watch how his final two years of high school unfold regarding his other sporting interests.

Huard is coming off a sophomore season where he completed 127 of 184 passes for 1,946 yards and 16 touchdowns. His team reached the 5A state semifinals.

A commitment from Huard would be significant for Sanders and CU, given the in-state and coaching connections, as well as the prestige of the schools currently involved.

Follow Charlie Strella¬†on¬†X,¬†Threads¬†and¬†Instagram.

title: One Thing Overall Got Kwesi Adofo-Mensah Fired
description: The Minnesota Vikings turned the page Friday on the Kwesi Adofo-Mensah era, firing the general manager after four seasons and [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Minnesota Vikings turned the page Friday on the Kwesi Adofo-Mensah era, firing the general manager after four seasons and promoting Vice President of Football Operations Rob Brzezinski to the interim GM role. Since Adofo-Mensah‚Äôs termination, several theories have swirled about why he got the boot, but one, above all else, takes the case: he drafted terribly.

Draft misses piled up, the roster aged fast, and Minnesota chose a reset at GM.

Of course, the Wilfs‚Äô (Vikings ownership) decision considered all moving parts, but the fact remains Adofo-Mensah would still be employed if he drafted at an average or better success rate.

Minnesota begins life without Adofo-Mensah for the first time in four years.

Some have already pointed to Adofo-Mensah‚Äôs paternity leave, which lasted two weeks, as the smoking gun or Adofo-Mensah‚Äôs inability to re-sign Sam Darnold or Daniel Jones in the 2025 offseason.

But when it gets down to brass tacks, Adofo-Mensah did not replenish the roster with enough talent through the draft. Each draft has seven picks per team, and through 28 eligible throws at the dartboard, Adofo-Mensah brought home Donovan Jackson, Dallas Turner, Will Reichard, Levi Drake Rodriguez, Jordan Addison, and Jalen Nailor. That‚Äôs about it.

His success rate in the draft landed at 20% if the tabulator is feeling generous. The draft is, of course, a crapshoot, but that means a general manager should not expect to hit 100% of the time. That doesn‚Äôt give him a license to strike out 80% of the time.

That‚Äôs what happened with Adofo-Mensah. Approximately four-fifths of his picks flamed out. It made Minnesota‚Äôs current roster old compared to other NFL teams. And that‚Äôs a problem for an organization that wishes to keep the Super Bowl window open at all times.

Compared to Other NFL Franchises

Here‚Äôs the horribly dooming stat ‚Äî

Most Games Started per Player by Team,
Players Drafted by THAT Team,
Since 2022:

Only the Dolphins did it more poorly, and that squad also fired its general manager a couple of months ago. The NFL draft is the only place in football to get players for free, and Minnesota whiffed more often than not under Adofo-Mensah.

J.J. McCarthy Alone Might Have Saved Adofo-Mensah

To be clear: the largest indictment, at least right now, is McCarthy not panning through two seasons. Had McCarthy thrived in 2025, as many expected, Adofo-Mensah would actually be championed right now. For Adofo-Mensah, his spotty draft resume could be reversed if he just hit on McCarthy.

So far, McCarthy has not produced, missing 70% of all Vikings games due to injury.

If McCarthy turns into a franchise quarterback with the Vikings or another team, Adofo-Mensah will have an ‚ÄúI told you so‚Äù argument. But that just doesn‚Äôt matter during the 2026 offseason because Minnesota must decide to keep him as the QB1 or acquire a different passer.

All signs point to the latter with Adofo-Mensah removed from his position.

CBS Sports‚Äò Robby Kalland wrote last weekend, ‚ÄúA new regime in Minnesota could mean changes at quarterback sooner rather than later. We‚Äôll find out exactly how much belief coach Kevin O‚ÄôConnell has in McCarthy, as Adofo-Mensah was clearly a strong believer in the young quarterback. A new GM, however, won‚Äôt have the same ties to him.‚Äù

‚ÄúAs such, one of the first major evaluations for whoever steps into the general manager role will be whether they view McCarthy as the franchise quarterback of the future. Given the Vikings‚Äô cap situation, it wouldn‚Äôt be surprising if McCarthy gets another year to show what he can do. Minnesota likely won‚Äôt be in the market for a high-priced free agent, and this year‚Äôs draft class isn‚Äôt highly regarded beyond Fernando Mendoza, who is the favorite to go No. 1 to the Raiders.‚Äù

Thankfully, Vikings fans can dream big again. They don‚Äôt have to dread the draft, an event that was guaranteed to result in underwhelming results over the last four years.

Pound-for-pound, the current roster is one of the NFL‚Äôs oldest. The only way to fix that is competent drafting in the next few years. Drafting rookies who play and remain on the roster for four years or more will go a long way toward changing the dynamic of an old roster.

Minnesota went all-in last year after completing its competitive rebuild plan, and with that strategy in full motion, the roster should be one of the league‚Äôs youngest ‚Äî not oldest.

Adofo-Mensah forced himself to use free agency as a replenishing mechanism for his sad draft tendencies. The next guy or group will use the draft foremost to find talent, with free agency as the cake topper. It‚Äôs the only sustainable way to contend for a Super Bowl.

title: 2026 NFL draft: Should New York Giants target WR Carnell Tate?
description: Pro Football Focus believes the New York Giants should target Ohio State WR Carnell Tate at No. 5 overall in the 2026 NFL draft.
fullText:
The New York Giants face a critical wide receiver need heading into the offseason, as highlighted in Pro Football Focus' analysis of teams' biggest priorities for free agency and the 2026 NFL draft.

PFF believes the Giants should focus on adding a receiver at No. 5 overall. Specifically, Ohio State wideout Carnell Tate.

Biggest Need: Wide receiver Target: WR Carnell Tate, Ohio State

Malik Nabers flashed star potential as a rookie in 2024, ranking eighth out of 133 qualifying wide receivers in PFF overall grade (86.7). He appeared in just four games this season before suffering a torn ACL, so we didn‚Äôt get an opportunity to see how he would develop with quarterback Jaxson Dart.

Beyond Nabers, the Giants' wide receiver unit looks thin, especially since slot specialist Wan'Dale Robinson is heading into free agency and may not be back with the team. Sometimes overshadowed by Jeremiah Smith at Ohio State, Tate is a polished prospect in his own right after finishing fifth in the FBS with an 89.0 PFF receiving grade. He also did not drop a single pass across 66 targets this season.

Nabers' injury-shortened 2025 campaign underscores the urgency for depth and a reliable complement.

Tate, a 6-foot-3 OSU standout, offers elite reliability -- boasting a near-perfect drop rate and strong efficiency even while sharing targets with top talents. His high PFF grades and production (875 yards and nine touchdowns in 2025 despite missing time) position him as a potential top-10 pick, frequently mocked to the Giants at No. 5.

Targeting Tate makes strategic sense to bolster Jaxson Dart's options and build around Nabers long-term. While the draft class is deep, passing on a polished, high-upside receiver like Tate could prolong the Giants' offensive struggles.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: 2026 NFL draft: Should New York Giants target WR Carnell Tate?

title: Bundesliga matchday 20 review: Bayern Munich drop more points, Mainz stun Leipzig, coach dismissals, and more
description: Matchday 20 in the Bundesliga saw Bayern Munich drop more points, Borussia Dortmund close the gap, Mainz 05 stun Leipzig, a head coach dismissal, and much more. Here is everything you need to know fro...
fullText:
Matchday 20 in the Bundesliga saw Bayern Munich drop more points, Borussia Dortmund close the gap, Mainz 05 stun Leipzig, a head coach dismissal, and much more. Here is everything you need to know from matchday 20 in the Bundesliga.

For the second week in a row, Bayern Munich failed to win a Bundesliga game. Vincent Kompany‚Äôs side were held to a hard-fought 2-2 draw against Hamburger SV in the Volksparstadion on Saturday evening.

It was a gutsy performance from HSV, who, if they stay up, will have their displays at home to thank. 16 of their 19 points in the league this season have all come from home, and perhaps this was the most satisfying of the lot.

Hamburg‚Äôs pressure was then rewarded when a Kimmich follow-up on Nicolai Remberg resulted in a penalty, which Fabio Vieria converted to make 1-0. However, just before half-time, Harry Kane would equalise for Bayern with a swivelling shot.

Just after half-time, substitute Luis Diaz scored to make it 2-1, but the game would continue to follow a similar pattern to the first half, and instead of accepting their fate, HSV came back and made it 2-2 through a Luka Vuskovic header.

At times in the second half, it looked as if Hamburg were the team more likely to win this game, as they had the better chances. The best example of this was when HSV countered, and a Philippe shot was cleared off the line by Alphonso Davies.

Bayern continued to increase the pressure on Hamburg. As the game approached full time, there would be a late penalty claim for handball, but the referee was having none of it ‚Äì much to the dismay of the Bayern coaching staff and players.

The draw now means Bayern have collected just a point from a possible six from the last two matchdays. For HSV, it‚Äôs a crucial point as they sit just a point outside the relegation zone.

In typical Borussia Dortmund fashion, they left it late to win and take advantage of Bayern Munich dropping more points.

Dortmund hosted rock-bottom FC Heidenheim on Sunday, with everyone thinking that the home side would cruise to victory and close the gap on the league leaders to just six points.

However, in classic Dortmund fashion, when Julian Niehues put Heidenheim 1-2 ahead in the second half, you could feel the collective groans from around Germany.

Dortmund pushed forward in search of an equaliser but, in doing so, left themselves exposed at the back. They were extremely fortunate not to fall two goals behind when Marvin Pieringer met a Hennes Behrens cross at the far post, only to somehow head over the crossbar when it appeared easier to score.

Dortmund‚Äôs pressure eventually brought them a lifeline when Niklas Dorsch handled Yan Couto‚Äôs cross inside the box. Guirassy stepped up and struck his penalty at Ramaj, who got a strong hand to it but could not prevent the ball from finding the back of the net.

Kovaƒç‚Äôs men sensed blood and immediately went on the attack again, with Maximilian Beier breaking down the wing before finding Guirassy through on goal. The striker made no mistake, slipping the ball underneath Ramaj at his near post to spark scenes of jubilation inside the Westfalenstadion.

BVB were then awarded another penalty when Guirassy was fouled by Tim Siersleben as he prepared to pull the trigger. With the chance to complete his hat-trick and effectively seal the win, the Guinean instead sent his spot-kick a good 10 yards over the crossbar in a woeful attempt at a Panenka.

In the closing stages, Heidenheim went in search of what they believed would have been a deserved equaliser, and in truth, they should have found it. They squandered multiple, and frankly, easy chances, to grab a late draw. On another day, Heidenheim would have run out 3-5 winners, and you wouldn‚Äôt have complained.

However, the footballing gods were shining down on BVB, who now go six points within Bayern at the summit.

Whilst there were some impressive results down the bottom of the league, possibly the biggest upset of matchday 20 was Mainz 05‚Äôs 1-2 away win at RB Leipzig.

Despite Ole Werner‚Äôs side taking an early lead, the 05ers were able to rally, and a late first-half penalty from Nadiem Amiri meant it was level at the break. On the other side of half-time, winter signing Silas scored his first goal for the club too to give Mainz the lead (both of these goals were scored in the 49th minute). The win for Urs Fischer‚Äôs side means that for the first time since Bundesliga matchday five, they were out of the bottom three, and have now only lost once since the Swiss replaced Bo Henriksen.

Elsewhere in the Bundesliga, Eintracht Frankfurt suffered another defeat, this time against Bayer Leverkusen, who ran out 1-3 winners. It now means that from the seven games Frankfurt have played in 2026, they‚Äôve conceded three goals in six of them. With Albert Riera taking charge on Monday, the Spaniard will have a lot of work to do when it comes to making this team a competent defensive team.

Werder Bremen drew 1-1 with Borussia Monchengladbach, meaning they‚Äôre now just outside the relegation spots and winless since November. With that, the club announced the sacking of head coach Horst Steffen. Bremen are looking at Bo Henrikson or Bo Svensson as Steffen‚Äôs replacement. Either way, there‚Äôs a good chance the next head coach of Bremen will be called Bo.

There were wins for TSG Hoffenheim (3-1 vs Union Berlin), VfB Stuttgart (1-0 vs SC Freiburg), FC K√∂ln (1-0 vs VfL Wolfsburg), and FC Augsburg (2-1 vs St. Pauli).

fullText:

Look, this ain‚Äôt it, and it shows. Oftentimes, the players look disjointed, and that killer instinct that characterized much of the past two decades is not there. I see a ‚Ä¶ re-calibration on the horizon and I can only hope it‚Äôs for the better.

What‚Äôs your take on the current condition of the team?

Now, Valencia often put up a good fight against us. They are a tough team to face in general. Vini or no Vini on the left wing, Jude or lack thereof, Real Madrid do ‚Äî on paper ‚Äî boast the firepower to beat Valencia. And I shall blatantly admit the satisfaction I feel when we do beat them. Yet, let‚Äôs not kid ourselves. We‚Äôre going into this one far from our peak state, both in terms of available players and in terms of confidence and chemistry.

title: Wayne Rooney launches Benjamin Sesko and Hugo Ekitike comparison after Fulham win
description: Manchester United legend Wayne Rooney has compared Benjamin Sesko and Liverpool forward Hugo Ekitike, following the former‚Äôs last-gasp winner against Fulham on Sunday.Sesko rescues UnitedUnited prod...
fullText:
Manchester United legend Wayne Rooney has compared Benjamin Sesko and Liverpool forward Hugo Ekitike, following the former‚Äôs last-gasp winner against Fulham on Sunday.

United produced a dramatic late show vs. Fulham at Old Trafford, to hand Michael Carrick his third successive victory since being named interim head coach.

The Red Devils took the lead in the 19th minute through Casemiro, who rose highest to head home a brilliant delivery from Bruno Fernandes. Casemiro then turned provider shortly after the break, slipping in a sensational no-look pass into the path of Matheus Cunha, who smashed the ball into the back of the net from a tight angle.

Carrick‚Äôs men appeared to be cruising until Harry Maguire conceded a penalty, which Raul Jimenez scored to halve the deficit.

Kevin scored a screamer in stoppage time to make it 2-2 and break the hearts of United supporters, but substitute Sesko had other ideas.¬†The Slovenian met Fernandes‚Äôs low cross, opened his body, and in one swift pivot, smashed the ball past a stranded Bernd Leno to win it.

The goal marked Sesko‚Äôs fifth in the Premier League this season, following his arrival in the summer. After the final whistle, a delighted Carrick was full of praise for the 22-year-old.

However, speaking on The Wayne Rooney Show, Rooney strongly suggested that United could have perhaps gone for Ekitike instead of Sesko.

Rooney launched a comparison of Viktor Gyokeres, Ekitike and Sesko, clearly explaining why he feels Ekitike is the better striker out of the three.

He said [as quoted by the Metro], ‚ÄúWe saw what Gyokeres did at Sporting, I know it was obviously a different country but he was scoring more goals than anyone and was absolutely on fire.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve backed Gyokeres this season and people have given me a bit of stick but I still think he‚Äôs making a different to Arsenal, I really do. He‚Äôs occupying defenders and that‚Äôs helping the team. I know he‚Äôs not got the goals or assists you‚Äôd want from your centre forward but I still think he‚Äôs having an impact.‚Äù

Asked whether he would take Gyokeres ahead of Ekitike, Rooney answered, ‚ÄúNo. Ekitike and [Granit] Xhaka at Sunderland have probably been the two best signings in the Premier League. I really enjoy watching Ekitike play. His second goal [against Newcastle] in particular was brilliant, it reminds me of Romario. A little toe-poke goal but it‚Äôs instinctive.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe is the type of player I like to watch. He‚Äôs not a number nine, he‚Äôs not a number 10. He drifts out wide, he gets on the ball, brings players into the game and he can score goals. So he‚Äôs got a bit of everything really.‚Äù

The former England international continued, ‚ÄúI really enjoy watching those type of players [like Ekitike]. He‚Äôs got that arrogance and confidence.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you look at Sesko for instance, he looks like he needs a bit of guidance and a bit of help when he‚Äôs on the pitch. I know he scored the winner today thankfully but he looks like he needs a bit of guidance whereas Hugo Ekitike it looks like you can just put him on the pitch.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got that swagger about him which I think you need to be at that top-level.‚Äù

United are next in action on Saturday when they host Thomas Frank‚Äôs Tottenham Hotspur in the early kick-off.

Featured image Carl Recine via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Top six could be 'best' yet - McFadden
description: This season's Scottish Premiership top six could be "the best" yet in terms of quality, according to former Motherwell forward James McFadden.  Hearts lead the division, with defending champions Celtic and Rangers six points adrift and Motherwell, Hibernian and Falkirk making up the top half of the table.  "It makes the top six extremely interesting," McFadden told the BBC's Scottish Football Podcast.
fullText:
This season's Scottish Premiership top six could be "the best" yet in terms of quality, according to former Motherwell forward James McFadden.

Hearts lead the division, with defending champions Celtic and Rangers six points adrift and Motherwell, Hibernian and Falkirk making up the top half of the table.

"It makes the top six extremely interesting," McFadden told the BBC's Scottish Football Podcast.

"Falkirk are in the driving seat at that point as well. They will be a tough opposition for anybody. The next three games, if Hearts can win, I would make them heavy favourites to win the league.

"If they can win all three games and, well, that's including beating Rangers, then it goes to nine points on Rangers.

"Rangers need to play Celtic, throw Motherwell into the equation. Hibs, you look, you know, at their performance [in the draw with Rangers].

"It'll be the best top six that we've had in this split era because so many teams have so much to play for and so many strong teams are in there."

title: Overtaking looks ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù with 2026 F1 cars, Esteban Ocon warns
description: 2026 F1 cars may not provide easier overtaking than their predecessors, the Haas drivers fear
fullText:
Both Esteban Ocon and Oliver Bearman are pessimistic about overtaking with Formula 1‚Äôs 2026 machinery following the Barcelona pre-season test.

The Haas drivers were on track for three days ‚Äì as many as allowed ‚Äì in F1‚Äôs ‚Äòshakedown‚Äô last week and completed nearly 400 laps according to unofficial data.

That was enough to get a taste of the new VF-26, which meets F1‚Äôs revamped chassis and engine regulations for the upcoming season, featuring stripped-down aerodynamics as downforce is reduced by 15-30% and drag is cut by up to 40%.

Yet, overtaking may prove even trickier than in the past, based on early impressions from the Catalan running ‚Äì even with the new Overtake Mode replacing DRS, which is a power boost for drivers within one second of a rival.

‚ÄúI've been following a few cars,‚Äù Ocon said. ‚ÄúYou seem to lose quite a lot of front load, a bit more maybe than before, but we need to see.¬†And the Overtake [Mode], yes, I played with it.

‚ÄúI don't want to give too early conclusions on how it's going to be because obviously, you know, it needs to be adjusted, optimised, etc.,¬†for that to work in a perfect way.¬†But so far, it looks to be difficult to pass. That's my first thought about it, but I hope it's going to get on the easier side.‚Äù

Sophomore team-mate Bearman concurred, pointing out ‚Äòquite a big shift in car balance‚Äô in dirty air right behind another car.

‚ÄúIn terms of following and overtaking and everything, I didn't really get a massive feeling on that of course, it's not a priority,‚Äù the 20-year-old Briton commented. ‚ÄúI managed to do a few laps in and around other cars.

‚ÄúI must say that it was a bit more challenging to follow, just given my relatively few laps I did. It picked up quite a big shift in balance compared to clean air, which seemed a bit more so than the previous generation of cars. But again, it's very early days.

‚ÄúNo, I didn't really get to use the overtake mode, but I was still able to try it just in clean air. We need to obviously see the difference in cooling and all of those things. So I was able to try it, but I wasn't able to use it to overtake someone, if that makes sense.‚Äù

Lewis Hamilton: ‚ÄòNew F1 cars more fun to drive‚Äô than previous eras

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

Fulback has been an area of need for the Blues for years now, even though David Moyes thinks Adam Aznou is not ready for the English top flight yet, and Jake O‚ÄôBrien is his preferred choice for all things right back related. Will the Blues make a move today for one or the other?

title: Bo or Bo? Svensson and Hendriksen top candidates for Bremen job
description: Bo Svensson and Bo Henriksen are reportedly the top candidates to succeed Horst Steffen as coach at struggling Bundesliga club Werder Bremen. Multiple reports on Monday named the two Danes as frontrunners, and Sky TV said that Bremen have started talks with them.
fullText:
Bo Svensson and Bo Henriksen are reportedly the top candidates to succeed Horst Steffen as coach at struggling Bundesliga club Werder Bremen.

Multiple reports on Monday named the two Danes as frontrunners, and Sky TV said that Bremen have started talks with them.

Steffen, who was signed in summer, was axed on Sunday in the wake of 10 games without victory and 15th place just above the danger zone. Bremen's next match is on Saturday in Freiburg.

Henriksen, 50, was fired at Mainz in December after saving them from relegation in 2024 and leading them into the Conference League last season.

Svensson, 46, is also a former Mainz coach, where he worked 2021-2023. He was then in charge at Union Berlin for six months, having to leave in December 2024 after a 4-1 defeat in Bremen.

title: Real Madrid defender has no intention of leaving despite overbooking ‚Äì report
description: According to a report from Mundo Deportivo, Ferland Mendy has no intention of leaving Real Madrid, despite growing congestion in his position and the club‚Äôs desire to move him on.It must be noted th...
fullText:
According to a report from Mundo Deportivo, Ferland Mendy has no intention of leaving Real Madrid, despite growing congestion in his position and the club‚Äôs desire to move him on.

It must be noted that the French full-back remains under contract with Los Blancos until 2027 and, for now, he is determined to see out his deal in Madrid.

This position comes at a time when the club is actively reviewing their options at left-back and are expected to once again open the door for Mendy‚Äôs exit in the summer.

Whether that door is used, however, depends entirely on the player.

The situation at left-back has become one of the most complex puzzles for Real Madrid‚Äôs sporting department.

As things stand, the squad includes Alvaro Carreras, Fran Garcia, and Mendy as natural options for the role.

On top of that, Eduardo Camavinga has once again shown, most recently against Rayo Vallecano, that he can comfortably operate on the left side of defence when needed.

Ferland Mendy does not want to leave Real Madrid. (Photo by Aitor Alcalde/Getty Images)

Real Madrid already made a major investment in the position last summer with the signing of Carreras from Benfica, paying a substantial ‚Ç¨50 million to secure his arrival.

Internally, the plan has been clear for some time. According to the aforementioned outlet, both Garcia and Mendy were seen as potential departures to balance the squad and reduce overcrowding.

Garcia even came close to leaving during the January transfer window, but Real Madrid ultimately blocked his exit.

That leaves Mendy as the central issue. Within the club, his departure would make the most sense in terms of squad planning. However, the player‚Äôs position is very clear in his position.

Despite limited continuity, injuries in recent seasons, and increased competition, Mendy has no plans to seek a move elsewhere.

Understandably, this creates a delicate situation, as forcing an exit is not straightforward, especially with a contract running until 2027.

At the same time, carrying multiple left-backs risks reducing minutes, disrupting squad harmony, and limiting opportunities.

title: Pick of the stats: Hull City v Watford
description: Here are the key stats for Hull City v Watford
fullText:
Hull City are aiming to keep up the pressure on their automatic promotion rivals Middlesbrough and Coventry City when they host Watford on Tuesday (19:45 GMT) at MKM Stadium.

The Tigers grinded out a 1-0 win at Blackburn Rovers on Saturday to record their fourth straight win in the Championship. They now have 53 points and are only five off second (W16 D5 L8).

Watford on the other hand are in a sticky patch of form with the Hornets winless in four league games following their 0-2 loss to Swansea at Vicarage Road on the weekend.

Hull City have won three of their last six home league meetings with Watford (D1 L2), but have failed to do so in both of the last two campaigns (1-2 in 2023-24, 1-1 in 2024-25).

Watford have won their last two league games against Hull City, and could complete a league double over the Tigers for the first time since the 1988-89 campaign.

Hull City have won eight of their 14 home league games this season (D2 L4), last winning nine times at home in a campaign in 2022-23 (5 in 2024-25, 8 in 2023-24).

Watford are unbeaten in each of their last four Championship away matches (W2 D2), their best streak on the road since going seven without loss under Val√©rien Isma√´l between December 2023 and January 2024.

Oli McBurnie has scored seven goals in nine league appearances for Hull City at the MKM Stadium and he is one away from his 50th home goal in the top four tiers of English football (34 in Championship, 12 in Premier League, 3 in League Two).

title: Serie A giants interested in Everton star
description: Juventus Make Enquiry for Everton Striker Beto as January Window Nears DeadlineJuventus have made an approach to explore the availability of Everton forward Beto as the Italian giants continue their s...
fullText:
Juventus have made an approach to explore the availability of Everton forward Beto as the Italian giants continue their search for attacking reinforcements before the January transfer window closes. The Serie A side are understood to be prioritising the addition of a centre-forward, with sources confirming that an enquiry has been lodged in recent days.

As first reported by talkSPORT, the Premier League club are reluctant to sanction a late departure, particularly without securing a replacement. With limited time remaining in the market, Everton‚Äôs stance reflects both squad depth concerns and their wider strategy for the remainder of the season.

The developing situation places Beto at the centre of renewed transfer speculation, while Juventus weigh up their next steps in a highly competitive market.

Juventus‚Äô recruitment focus has sharpened significantly as the window enters its final stages. Senior club figures have identified the need for additional firepower, particularly in light of inconsistent goal output and the physical demands of domestic and European competition.

Beto has emerged as a realistic option following internal assessments and market analysis. The Portuguese-born Guinea-Bissau international offers physical presence, aerial strength and experience in both Serie A and the Premier League, having previously featured for Udinese before joining Everton.

Juventus had previously explored alternative targets, including high-profile forwards from within the Premier League, but valuation concerns and limited availability forced a reassessment. Attention has now turned towards players viewed as attainable within financial and regulatory frameworks.

While discussions remain at an exploratory stage, the enquiry highlights Juventus‚Äô intent to move decisively if favourable conditions arise.

Everton‚Äôs reluctance to engage in formal negotiations reflects broader concerns surrounding squad balance and depth. Beto remains one of only two senior central strikers currently available to the club, making any mid-season exit a significant sporting risk.

Since arriving from Udinese for a substantial fee, the striker has experienced mixed fortunes on Merseyside. He has contributed goals across competitions but has also faced periods of inconsistency and limited service.

Despite this, club officials continue to value his work rate, physical contribution and professionalism. Internally, there is recognition that losing a recognised forward at this stage of the campaign could undermine stability in key fixtures.

Unless Everton can identify and secure a suitable replacement in quick succession, their position is unlikely to soften.

Under David Moyes, Beto has remained an important squad figure despite fluctuating form. His recent performances, including a dramatic late equaliser away from home, have reinforced his value to the coaching staff.

The Everton manager has repeatedly highlighted the striker‚Äôs commitment and willingness to improve. Public comments following recent matches suggest belief that confidence and continuity could unlock further progress.

Statistically, Beto‚Äôs output this season reflects steady, if unspectacular, returns. Three league goals and additional contributions in cup competitions underline his ability to influence games, particularly in high-pressure moments.

From a tactical perspective, his profile suits teams seeking a direct focal point, capable of occupying defenders and creating space for attacking runners. This makes him an appealing option for Juventus as they assess compatibility with their existing squad.

With the transfer window approaching its conclusion, Juventus face a strategic decision. They must weigh Everton‚Äôs firm stance against the urgency of strengthening their attack.

Potential solutions include structured loan proposals, options to buy, or late compromise on valuation. However, Everton‚Äôs negotiating position remains strong, particularly given the limited time available to reinvest.

For Beto, the situation represents both opportunity and uncertainty. A return to Serie A could offer familiarity and renewed momentum, yet stability and regular minutes at Everton remain valuable for his development.

Unless negotiations accelerate significantly, a move before deadline day appears challenging. Juventus may yet explore alternative targets, while Everton continue preparations with the expectation that their striker will remain.

Nevertheless, as recent windows have demonstrated, late-market dynamics can shift rapidly, and both clubs remain alert to developments.

title: Alex Marquez: "Gresini is the most solid option, but this may be a time to take a risk."
description: Alex Marquez insists Gresini is the "most solid option" for him, but does not rule out leaving Ducati's satellite team to chase a factory seat
fullText:
Alex Marquez, who is finalising his signing with KTM‚Äôs factory team for 2027, believes that more than half of the MotoGP grid will have their contracts settled before the first race of the season.

The younger Marquez's market value has increased¬†exponentially since he finished runner-up in the 2025 standings. At 29 years of age, and after six seasons in MotoGP, the time has probably come for him to capitalise on it.

In this regard, Motorsport.com understands that the Gresini rider has virtually sealed his future from 2027 onwards with KTM. Pending the final signature, which should be formalised over the coming days, Marquez will share the garage with Maverick Vinales, who will step up from the Tech3 team.

‚ÄúThe objective of every rider is to race for a factory team. But I‚Äôm very happy at Gresini. When the moment comes I will decide what is best for my future, but for now I want to focus on this pre-season,‚Äù Marquez said at the Sepang circuit, where the first three days of collective testing for 2026 get underway on Tuesday.

In his best season in the premier class, the Spaniard amassed three victories and a total of 12 podiums, allowing him to finish just behind his brother Marc Marquez, who was nearly untouchable until he was injured in Indonesia.

In addition to the runner-up spot, that achievement enabled Alex Marquez to improve his status within Ducati, to the point of securing the latest Desmosedici for the upcoming campaign.

After a few frenetic days regarding the rider market, Marquez gave away little information, so that no one could interpret from his words that he has already decided which leathers he will be wearing.

‚ÄúWe are working to have the best options when the moment to decide arrives. I won‚Äôt hide that Gresini is the most solid option, but it‚Äôs true that maybe this is a moment to take a risk, because you don‚Äôt know which bike will be the most competitive under the new regulations,‚Äù he said.

Marquez has previously been a factory rider in MotoGP, riding for Repsol Honda in 2020 when he made his debut in the premier class.

Marquez is convinced that most pieces of the puzzle could fall into place before the lights go out in Buriram on the first weekend of March.

‚ÄúMore than 50% of the grid will have their future settled before the first race. Many teams, many manufacturers need to sign riders early so they don‚Äôt slip away,‚Äù he said.

Alex Marquez targeting factory MotoGP seat at Yamaha and KTM

title: Social media reacts to Nets' Michael Porter Jr.'s All-Star Game snub
description: Brooklyn Nets forward Michael Porter Jr. did not make the 2026 NBA All-Star Game on Sunday and social media reacted to his unexpected snub.
fullText:
Brooklyn Nets forward Michael Porter Jr. was thought at one point in time to be one of the players that was going to make the All-Star Game for the first time in his career given the season that he's had to this point. In anticipation of Porter being Brooklyn's first All-Star since the 2021-22 season (Kevin Durant), there were plenty of questions asked of the organization regarding the honor, until it was revealed that Porter would not be named an All-Star after all.

On Sunday, around the same time that the Nets tipped off for what ended up being their 130-77 loss at the Detroit Pistons, it was reported by various insiders that Porter did not make the 2026 Eastern Conference All-Star team as a reserve. While there seemed to be virtual locks to make the team as a reserve, such as Cleveland Cavaliers guard Donovan Mitchell and Atlanta Hawks forward Jalen Johnson, Porter was considered by many to be among that group due to his impact on Brooklyn this season.

The reserves for the East are Mitchell, Johnson,¬†New York Knicks¬†center Karl-Anthony Towns,¬†Indiana Pacers¬†forward Pascal Siakam,¬†Miami Heat¬†guard Norman Powell,¬†Toronto Raptors¬†forward Scottie Barnes, and¬†Detroit Pistons¬†center Jalen Duren. Those seven players will join the five starters in¬†Philadelphia 76ers¬†guard Tyrese Maxey, Knicks guard Jalen Brunson, Pistons guard Cade Cunningham, Boston Celtics forward Jaylen Brown, and¬†Milwaukee Bucks¬†forward Giannis Antetokounmpo.

Wow, I really thought Nets forward Michael Porter Jr. was going to the All-Star Game. My guess is that the voting came down to Porter and Pacers forward Pascal Siakam. https://t.co/09uVZSckSk

‚Äî Sharif Phillips-Keaton (@SharifKeaton) February 1, 2026

Porter,¬†27, is having the best season of his career as he is averaging 25.6 points, 7.3 rebounds, and 3.2 assists per game while shooting 48.2% from the field and 39.8% from three-point land in 38 appearances. While Brooklyn (13-34) has one of the worst records in the Eastern Conference, part of Porter's case was the fact that the Nets are just¬†1-9¬†without him in the lineup, demonstrating his importance to the team.

While Porter didn't make the All-Star team despite the push by many to see him be among the players making an All-Star appearance for the first time in their career, that doesn't take away from the fact that he's having a terrific season and he's far from the only snub. Here's how social media reacted to Porter being snubbed from the 2026 NBA All-Star Game:

Michael Porter Jr. is an incredible snub from the All-Star Game.

The Eastern Conference coaches should be ashamed that they voted based on reputation and/or team record. We have metrics in 2026 to capture the impact on winning from individuals rather than lazily looking to team‚Ä¶ https://t.co/abYtZ95IXZ pic.twitter.com/bXQ6pCcMJf

‚Äî Billy Reinhardt (@BillyReinhardt) February 1, 2026

title: Athletic: Kinsky not leaving Spurs this window
